name: Raw Materials
description: Which Raw Materials are used for Production? Raw Materials can be Tungsten, Tin, plastic, gold (3TG), lead, high-temperature solder, cobalt, lithium, tantalum

name: Toxic Chemical Materials
description: Which Chemical Materials are used for Production? Chemical Materials can be beryllium, brominated flame retardants, PVC, phthalates, arsenic in the glass, and mercury

name: Alternative Materials
description: Which Alternatives are used for Production? Those can be bio-based plastic

name: Materials Source
description: Where do the Raw Materials come from

name: Transportation
description: Which distances have to be done between the production sites. Look out for tokens like 'km' or 'miles'

name: Production Waste
description: How many waste occors during the manufacturing process. How is dealt with the waste?

name: top notch technology
description: Does the phone keeps up with the modern standards? By doing so the probability, that the phone has to be replaced by a newer one soon is reduced.

name: Durability
description: How long will the phone be in use, how quickly will it be outdated. How quickly may the user wasn't a new phone, based on the lesser quality of the given phone?

name: Second Use
description: The probability the phone can be sold or passed down for second use. It mainly depends on the quality the phone has after the mean use period of two years.

name: Recycling
description: The Degree of parts and materials, which can be returned in production.
